skill.name: react-observability
skill.description: Logging, error messages, and debugging patterns for React. Use when adding logging, designing error messages, debugging production issues, or improving code observability. Works for both React web and React Native.
skill.summary: Logging, error messages, and debugging patterns for React. Use when adding logging, designing error ...
skill.author: CJHarmath

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown patterns and code examples for React observability. No executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access, no command execution.

content.value_statement: Silent failures and missing logs make production debugging impossible. Get patterns for logging, error messages, and debugging that make issues diagnosable at any hour.
actual_capabilities: Write structured logging with context objects
Design error messages with diagnostic information
Implement flow tracing for multi-step operations
Handle sensitive data in logs securely
Create React error boundaries for graceful failures
Add state snapshots for debugging complex flows
limitations: Does not execute or modify your code directly
Does not integrate with specific logging services
React Native support is limited to conceptual patterns

use_cases.title: Add logging to React components
use_cases.description: Implement structured logging in React components for better debugging

use_cases.title: Design error messages
use_cases.description: Create error messages with diagnostic context for faster debugging

use_cases.title: Trace multi-step flows
use_cases.description: Add flow tracing to complex async operations for visibility into failures

prompt_templates.title: Basic logging
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to add logging to this function with context: [paste function code]

prompt_templates.title: Error messages
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite this error message to include diagnostic context: [paste error handling code]

prompt_templates.title: Flow tracing
prompt_templates.prompt: Add flow tracing to this multi-step operation: [paste async flow code]

prompt_templates.title: Error boundaries
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an error boundary for this component with custom fallback: [paste component]

output_examples.input: Add observability to this function that saves user data
output: ‚úì Added structured logger wrapper with debug, info, warn, error levels
‚úì Added context object with id, value, and existingCount
‚úì Early return now logs invalid ID with full context
‚úì Error messages include diagnostic information: function name, what failed, relevant state
‚úì Sensitive data redaction helper added for secure logging
‚úì Flow ID generated for tracing multi-step operations

best_practices: Log early returns with context explaining why the function exited
Include relevant state values in error messages for faster debugging
Use flow IDs to trace multi-step operations across async boundaries
anti_patterns: Throwing errors with generic messages like 'Data not found' without context
Logging sensitive data like passwords, tokens, or API keys
Silently catching errors without any logging or rethrow

faq.question: What platforms does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with React web and React Native. Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What logging levels should I use?
faq.answer: Error for exceptions, warn for unexpected conditions, info for business events, debug for diagnostics.

faq.question: Can this integrate with Sentry or other services?
faq.answer: Provides patterns for integration but does not install or configure services directly.

faq.question: Is my data safe when logging?
faq.answer: Skill includes patterns for redacting sensitive data like passwords, tokens, and API keys.

faq.question: Why are my logs not showing in production?
faq.answer: Check log levels are set correctly for production. Use environment-based configuration.

faq.question: How is this different from console.log?
faq.answer: Structured logging adds context objects, consistent formatting, and filtering by log level.
